description: Method exists at compile time but not at runtime. Typically caused by dependency version conflicts or ProGuard issues.
commonCauses: API level mismatch (using newer API on old device)
solutions: Update all dependencies to compatible versions
Add ProGuard keep rules for missing methods
Use dependency resolution strategy in Gradle
prevention: Keep dependencies up to date and compatible
Use bill of materials (BOM) for version management
Test with minifyEnabled true in debug builds
Document minimum API levels for features
